Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and easy accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ipggi
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Novotel. The location is well placed being walking distance from Sharaf DG Metro station yet placed off the main motorway so to avoid some of the traffic noise.  A short taxi or metro trip is all that is required to reach to the main beaches in Dubai. While The Mall of the Emirates is only a few hundred metres walk. The rooms were well appointed, modern and spacious for the price. 2 free water bottles are supplied each day. A separate toilet from the bathroom which housed both an individual shower and a bath. Space in the shower was a little tight though and the spray head was oddly directed towards the wall. The TV was a large Samsung LCD supplied with a standard collection of English and international channels. The bed would be considered hard by some but this seems to be the standard experience with many Middle Eastern rooms. Free internet was included in my price but it was served via a wired Ethernet cable. Free Wifi can be found in the lobby, reading room and business centre. The centre also houses 3 free to use desktops. During my stay breakfast was offered for 55DH which was a choice of a la carte in the hotel restaurant or buffet in the interconnected IBIS next door. I preferred al a carte which had a greater variety than the buffet and was cooked to order. If catching the metro to the hotel, get off a Sharaf DG station on the red line and get a taxi outside. The taxi will cost 10DH but it makes finding the hotel for the first time much easier.

Reviews.Title: “shop and ski”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Mall of Emirates shopping mall with indoor ski resort.Italian restaurant at hotel was good value although reception tried to charge me twice for breakfast but was easily corrected.Staff very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “rough start”
Reviews.Author: Yagen5
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, we had a minor rough start since we had made a mistake in our bookings and booked a suite for 3 adults, but had put it was only 2 adults. When I realized this I didn't think much of it, since we booked the largest room after all since there were 3 of us. But anyways we were advised at check in that we had to pay an extra charge for the 3rd person and we were a little upset and finally agreed to it and moved on. When we got to the room and showered my husbands towel had dried up blood on it which was absolutely disgusting. We took it to the manager and spoke to him and he apologized over and over again and deft made it up to us. He waived 2 of the 3 nights extra charge for the extra person charge and gave us comp breakfast at the hotel restaurant. The pool area is nice and the rest offers yummy food at reasonable prices and very convinient. The location of the hotel is great. You can go str8 from airport to exit 33 on metro and walk to hotel. You can walk to mall of emirates and ski dubai. Great location. The hotel room was also nice inside and you get free water everyday!

Reviews.Title: “Rock hard beds, tiny rooms but fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: PerthPhil Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with truly great service and unbelievably helpful staff, but with a few items that can be tough to deal depending on your own needs and desires. The service here is easily on par with the best I have seen across the globe - especially given it is a mid-priced hotel in the area. The rooms (well, our room) was a good size, but the toilet and bathroom were both tiny. I mean, you were brushing your stomach against the door when closing it in the toilet and the shower was a funny trapezoid shape which was bordering on small for the large side and battling to lift your arms on the other side. In downtown Italy, Paris or London you would expect this and it would be totally ok... but in Dubai where everything is massive and spacious, it is very much out of place. The beds were as hard as planks of wood but the staff were really helpful and placed 4-5 doonas (fluffy quilts) under the bottom sheet to make it more comfortable. Maybe this is a Dubai thing but I have slept on the shores of the Colorado River and in the sandy deserts of Moab, Utah and didn't come close to how firm these beds were. We very nearly changed hotels over it but were only staying for a week. The breakfast is great and you have a choice of both the a-la-carte menu from Novotel or the Buffet breakfast in the adjoining Ibis (big door connecting the two) as it looks like the two are the same ownership or management. The major draw card of Suite Novotel is it's closeness to Mall of the Emirates. This mall doesn't compare in either size or selection to Dubai Mall down town, but it has the largest indoor ski run in the world (and only black diamond run) within 5 mins walking distance. Admittedly you have to cross a couple of roads and negotiate some traffic but it is easy enough to get to and easily the cheapest way to learn to ski. Everything but gloves and beanie included in the price and the training staff at Dubai Ski are excellent. If I had my time again (and I will be back) I would probably stay at the Kempinski Hotel located in the mall and 50 metres from Dubai Ski entrance. The pricing is a little bit more but gives you ready access to a range of restaurants and activities with some funky bars. Don't forget to try Salmontini Restaurant whichever hotel you stay at where you can overlook the ski run while eating some pretty good Sashimi! Oh - and finally, Internet charges were AED100 (about US$25 for 12hrs or $50/day) which for an advanced country is really steep!!! We ended up getting a couple of Ahlan SIM packages with Etisalat which gave us high speed internet and phone calls for about the price of a day's internet at the hotel. Another personal learning experience to check out the price of Internet BEFORE we selected the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Great stay and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: DK-Desi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 night with family and friends. As mentioned by other reviewers, the hotel is very close to Mall of the Emirates. Not difficult to get to the mall at all. We payed full price for the breakfast, which meant we could either choose between international buffet and a la carte. The buffet was quite okay for the price paid (55 dirham), however the a la carte option was much better. We used both. (however if you are a coffee lover the international buffet offer much better coffee than the a la carte option). The pool is quite ok. Not large and only with 10 sunbeds. The pool staff is helpfull. The whole staff at the hotel is actually very friendly and attentative. Vikram was the best and became friend of the kids we were travelling with. Everyone from housekeeping, laundry, reception, restuarant, bell boy were friendly and very helpfull. The hotel is clean and rooms very good. The cafetaria just in front of the hotel offer a variety of food but very expensive according to general prices in Dubai. We booked the hotel through accor.com and we got great discount as Aclub-members. All our request forwarded to the hotel was honored on arrival. Thanks to the staff we had an excellent stay. I wish the free wifi were available in rooms as well instead of the lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price paid”
Reviews.Author: toesy
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel due to its close proximity to the Mall of Emirates. It is a 5 mins walk to the mall and is fairly easy to find your way there. However, a few cab drivers we asked didn't seem to know where the hotel was and it was only when we told them that it was next to ibis hotel that they knew. One of the staff told us that the hotel operated under a different name previously. The check in process was swift but I was given incorrect information. The staff told me that free wifi is only available in the lobby and Internet access in rooms is through LAN cable and is chargeable. Because of that, I spent my first night in the lobby working on my laptop. It was only when i double checked my booking confirmation did i realize my booking came with free internet access in the room. When i called the reception to verify, she was unable to give me an answer but promised to call back. In the end, she called my room and confirmed that I was entitled to it. Nonetheless, the staff were generally very friendly and polite. The overall service was good. The room was comfortable and came with a double bed and a sofa couch. However, do note that the toilet and bathroom are separated. My main complaint is with the shower cubicle in the bathroom. Despite a glass door seperating the cubicle and the rest of the bathroom, water seeps out to the bathroom when I shower, wetting the floor almost entirely.

Reviews.Title: “good stay minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: as an overall good hotel pros : beside mall of emirates and metro . good price . and big rooms (in comparison to Ibis mall of emirates). relaxing enviroment cons: noise while sleeping . no good breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “everything you need”
Reviews.Author: nayster
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights good: location to mall and transport, room is large with comfy bed and big bathroom, great internet area downstairs and breakky was faantasic! tour pick ups from out front and friendly staff, lounge area in room, table and chair and great tv. line over bath to hang hand washed clothes not so good: we arrived early and tired from a 15 hr flight and had to pay $70 aus extra to check in early. we reserved a non smoking room but were told none were available so we had to take smoking room which stank, as did the entire floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, friendly staff...great hotel. Recommend it to everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ongrodney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. Check-in was fast. The room is clean, modern, nice and quite big. It is also well equipped and most toiletries are also provided in the shower room. The shower cubicle is rather small eventhough the shower room itself is quite big with a nice bathtub. Location of the hotel is also quite good although you may have to cross a busy street between the hotel and mall of the emirates. Just turn left as you exit the moe after ski-dubai and keep walking until you reach a pedestrian crossing. Cross the road and you should see the hotel on your right. The service standard of the hotel is also very good. The staffs are friendly and helpful. They would be glad to assist you if you have any queries or needs. Also, they will serve you during breakfast if you choose the ala-carte type versus the buffet option. Breakfast was nice and adequate. The buffet variety was fine although I would prefer the ala-carte breakfast for the asian set meal. It was a nice stay. We would love to stay again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: passiondevoyager
Reviews.Content: Hotel has good vibes, nice modern design and very helpful and courteous staff. Location is pretty convenient, walking distance from the Mall of the Emirates and the metro station. Beds are not the most comfortable, neither is sofa bed. We found it awfully inconvenient to have only one toilet for a group of five and 3 places to shower! It would have been much nicer if the shower in main bath was made into a toilet. Breakfast was good, not the fanciest but satisfying. Value for money is pretty decent, highly recommended if you're trying not to overspend on your accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BishopD
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early hours of the morning only to find that the sofa bed in our room had not been made up. After sleeping on the sofa bed my son received several bite marks on his legs. My wife made a separate stay at the hotel a week later and had a similar disappointing experience. The towels were smelling and the standard of food in the restaurant was extremely poor. Needless to say we will not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny suite or a good sized room?”
Reviews.Author: Willis68
Reviews.Content: I like a bit of space when I travel. I am not a 'shoebox' fan and like room to swing the proverbial cat. So I thought that a "suite" would be a good sized room or more like a hotel / apartment. I was therefore disappointed to find that the dividing line between a room and a suite - I kid you not - is a curtain! Yes - this room has a curtain that separates a sofa and table from the bed! That is what Novotel mean by a suite! I fully accept that I misunderstood the description of the room - which is a normal to big sized hotel room - however, I was disappointed. I also find the layout of the room strange - a tiny loo - by the door, separate and tight-ish bathroom with no loo and then a massive minibar / kettle area and then the rest of the room dominated by big cupboards. I don't know, but I would have thought that a massive group such as Novotel would have room layout down pat. The common areas are all very smart - buzzy lobby - nice pool and gym. I also found the bathroom quite grubby. I know its hard but finding one of housekeepings hairs in the sink isn't great either. I ordered room service and while the food tasted good, the plastic take away boxes and plastic knife and fork were a bit of a put off and made me question the Dhs 55 ($15) price tag. The bed is comfortable, nice and quiet room but I am not sure I would come back or recommend this hotel. The Kenyan guy at the front desk was friendly and there is a great Ghanaian bell hop. Free parking in the basement is good. No wifi in the rooms but free wifi in the lobby. I find the whole internet thing a bit annoying - either it should be free or not but this free here / pay there thing, especially when the pay internet is cable only is really annoying. Some whinges here Novotel but if I thought this was a normal hotel not a 'suite' I might not feel so disgruntled.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep?? Forget it.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Don't try sleeping here - 3 nights - 3 nights of technical faults (or otherwise) of phone system that hotel could not solve. Random ringing of all 5 phones in the room. Some phones could not be removed (such as those mounted to bathroom walls - there were 2 bathrooms and 1 toilet phone, plus 2 phones in living areas). Soundproofing between rooms not present or completed - easy to hear neighbouring conversations and televisions. Heavy set doors bang of course on closure. Prepaid booking, first in line on arrival at 1:30am, still had to wait 30 minutes to check-in due slow computers and incessant questions and re-supplying data already supplied when booking. Finally, room not being correctly prepared delayed sleep on first night further. Baby bed not setup, sofa bed not setup.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Very nice staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiki563
Reviews.Content: Great location, good food, nice rooms. Free access to internet - wireless!! But the most important... Very nice and warm staff! I had to leave my lugagge in the hotel for a couple of days as I had another short trip to do. I thought it would be a problem as I was not a guest of the hotel anymore. However all the staff were really nice, they understood my problem and have accepted to store my huge lugagge (8 bags!!) for a few days while I was travelling! The best part... they didn't charge me anything!! I would like to make a special compliment to John from the front desk. He was very nice to me and my family during our stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “It was a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: azizkm Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 4 times before my last stay. I think this will be my last stay for the following reasons: 1. Cleanliness: - the furniture become little dirty. - Could not use the towels, which was very old and obsolete. - There is very bad smell in the lobby, elevators, corridors, and in the rooms. Ventilation is bad in the room b/c there is no open window. 2. Price: it was cheaper, but now more expensive and can get better hotel in the city. 3. Wifi: is available free, but only in the lobby. 4. Sleep quality: it was very noisy, and could not sleep well. on the other hand, advantages are: 1. Location: Mall of the emirates is cross the street + resturants/laundry/grocery/barber/spa are next tot he hotel. the hotel is 10 min from Dubai Mall, and 10 min from JPR. there is Metro station in the mall of emirates. 2. Staff are very friendly. 3. Play station + computers are provided free in the lobby. 4. Water boiler + Coffee is free in the room. 5. Toilet + Bed sheets + Bellows are very clean. The hotel need to renovate furniture + towels, and to reduce prices as before.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: wkulisz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Suites is a good hotel located in new area of Dubai 200m from Mall of Emirates. Rooms and quality of service is very good, breakfast is quite expensive, beter is to go to the Mall and eat there and what is more free Internet only at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but in my opinion does not meet Novotel standards”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeOMuscat
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a couple of nights and very convenient as it is steps from Emirates Mall, but really lacks in meeting the Novotel standards. General area house keeping is not great as the place smells of stagnant mop water, towels are substandard 2 star hotel rating and staff is not really up to par yet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmonsalve
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice and clean. Staff is kind and helpfull. They were very nice and gave my little baby a plush toy (nice touch). Room was beautifull, clean and spacious. The location is really good, near the mall, near the metro station and also you can take a cab in the door at any time. TIP: restaurant across the street is better and cheaper. The indian restaurant next to the hotel is also very good and really cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Live Luxury at Fair Prices”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times before. It is very clean and the staff is always very helpful. There are times when Room Service could have been improved when ordering something late at night, but overall the staff are extremely friendly. This hotel is ideally located next to the Mall of Emirates, which also means you have easy access to the metro. Parking spaces are always available. The room that fits 3 people is more comfortable for two people as the room is a bit small, but the sleeping quality was pretty good for all 3 of us. The Deli at the reception provides an array of food items that can adequately suit your needs. Also, there are supermarkets, dry cleaning services, and pharmacies withing walking distance. Suitehotel and Ibis both belong to Accor Hotels but honestly Suite Hotel Mall of Emirates is much much better with regards to staff, cleanliness, status, and service. I would definetely recommend this hotel to couples and families alike. The hotel also features a fully equiped gym. I think they have a pool but I'm not sure because I was never really interested in finding out. Once you try the hotel for yourself, and if you enjoyed your stay then as a tip you should register as an A Club Member which entitles you for special promotions when you keep using any of the Accor Hotels worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: unz_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in September for 3 nights, great rate for the location and hotel. Location is great, not far from metro, which you can go to mall of dubai etc and also right beside mall of the Emirates, which hosts ski dubai. We had a lovely stay here and i would definitely stay here again on my next visit. Roof top pool was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in modern style with very friendly staff, clean and fresh rooms,highly recommendable!!”
Reviews.Author: Andreas K
Reviews.Content: Me Andreas my wife stayed here 11 days on our honeymoon, from Dec 22-Jan 2, 2011/2012. We were very happy with this hotel!! The staff is very helpful And friendly. They have a restaurant open 24h which was very nice because of our arrival in the middle of the night. They have a pool on the roof which is quite small but ok. They also have a gym with dumbells, runnig machine and some basic stuff, not the biggest gym but very fresh! Free internet in the lobby! They serve alcohol. In Dubai, all alcohol is only sold on restaurants/bars connected to hotels... This hotel is suited just a 2 minute walk from a very big mall, which we went to several times during our stay. In there, they have tons of restaurants, and over 400 shops !! Maybe the only downside of this hotel is the location, its kind of in the middle between downtown in the north and the south part. The city is not very walkable, lots of freewAys. The good thing is that taxis are very cheap, so we went atleast 3-4 rides every day. Be sure to take the taxis that are marked "taxi" and dont go for the private ones. Private taxis are safe, but atleast twice or three times more expensive. The start rate is 3 AED (Dirhams), but from the airport they start at 25 AED. A taxiride for 15 minutes cost around 30-40 AED. In December the average temperature is around 25 degrees Celsius during the day, but bring a sweater or smaller jacket for nighttime when its quite cool.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean with rooftop pool.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_lover92
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in August 2011 for 4 days for the first part of our honeymoon before flying to the Maldives This hotel is located 2 minutes walk from the mall. The rooms were comfortable with bath, shower, fridge and safe. Modern room and very clean. The pool on the roof is small but nice. Generally you would get a taxi to most places due to the heat, so location is not really relevant. It has a restaurant downstairs selling full dinners of snacks, paninis, baguettes crisps chocolate etc which is very nice. The breakfast is mostly continental with a few more bits, baked beans, eggs, no bacon or sausages (as they don't eat pork) but still very nice with lots of pastries and cereals, yoghurts, fruit etc Meet your rep when you get there and book trips as some things book up quick, the afternoon tea in the burj a larab (7* hotel) is expensive but absolutely amazing. The Dubai creek boat cruise is nice. Be prepared to be very very very hot!!! Loved our stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My friend and I loved staying at this hotel! It is right next to the Mall of the Emirates and the train station. The hotel is upscale but affordable. It has a nice, small rooftop pool and chairs as well as a gym. The front desk staff were wonderful in answering all of our questions and helping us navigate Dubai. There's also free Internet and computers down in the lobby in an alcove off to the side. Very classy and affordable! Stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with one obstacle!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A superplace with it´s situation within walkingdistance from Mall of the Emirates. Good standard and pleasant service. Our obstacle was that the hotelbooking confirmation said that we had paid for the breakfirst as we ordered and antisipated that we had. But the hotel showed us after a couple of days that they hadn´t deducted the amount from my account. Annoying I think. They should change their system I think. Otherwise you should check your accounts before you checkin at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “titel suite but not realy”
Reviews.Author: Abdulwahab B
Reviews.Content: the room is bigger than other novotel with devision of curtain to the sofa and table with 2 chairs , WC very small hardly you can clse the door , location is nice if you want to be next to Emirats mall and the ice skying rank new aria of AlBarsha near to Dubai marina and JBR next to the metro station

Reviews.Title: “Design failure and no hygene protocol for cleansiness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The design of the room is not functional at all. The toilet is not in the bathroom area. The toilet room is hard to get in and then close the door. The sink of the bath area is high and not functional. The shower is so small. Instead of having a shower and a tub, maybe you combine them with one big shower that is functional. the soap has a strong perfume. there are a lot of people who have allergies to that. When the housekeeping crew clean the rooms, they do everything without washing their hands between cleaning the bathroom and changing the sheets or carrying the water bottles. They also use the same clothes they clean other rooms to wipe the bathroom and sinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Base”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option if you want to stay as a family. Good location- easy walking distance to two metro stops and the Mall of the Emirates. Also offers a free shuttle service to Jumeirah beach. Was really handy having two bathrooms. The only negative is that the whole hotel smells very musty, and the windows don't open to allow fresh air. Also, the toilet room is tiny and there is barely enough room for a person to fit. Otherwise found it a great base to explore Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: Whilst being impossible to be well-located in Dubai, this is pretty much as central as you can get being half way between downtown and the palms area, and close to Jumeirah. The rooms are very spacious and suitable for families with children. The staff were great and very helpful considering our flight meant we arrived at the hotel 7 hours before check-in and they sorted out a room relatively quickly. The shared breakfast area with the Ibis next door isn't that great, but is adequate. Apart from the coffee which is poor. However, the important stuff is great and the service is helpful and smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for all services including the new metro. Close to shops and the Msll of the Emirates makes it ideal. The food and beverage service service is good and WiFi is free in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, relax and shop”
Reviews.Author: Jadegrub Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was a decent size and the facilities were clean. I traveled here alone and loved my stay at the hotel. It was relaxing and the rooftop pool is amazing. There is also a free shuttle bus daily to the jumeriah beach park. It is right next door the Mall of the Emirates and the Metro. Bit far away from the main city but the quietness was nice. Also felt like a very safe and clean area of Dubai. I would stay here again although next time, I would like to be closer to the main city area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: StevAus
Reviews.Content: Located near the Mall of the Emirates this is a great hotel for the shoppers. A short taxi ride to other attractions as well. The suites provided adequate room for two adults and two children and the the bathrooms were a great convenience. Service was excellent and the restaurant catered wonderfully to our daughter's food allergy - as did all of the restaurants we visited during our stay in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: JonJo121
Reviews.Content: Solid four star hotel. Room cleaned every day by friendly helpful staff. 12m outdoor swimming pool. Good location and price. Free wifi in Lobby. ALL staff helpful. Let me check in early and check out late.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MikeandLyndaC
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Dubai, the first being 11 years ago, and the change was incredible. This hotel is very near to the Emirates Mall, which was great for food as there is a large food mall serving various styles of food. This meant we could eat really cheapily in what can be an expensive city. The other great thing about this hotel is that it around 400 yards from the new metro line at Sharaf station, although there is another station in the Emirates Mall. A day's pass on the metro is 16AED, about £3.00, and you can see all the major sites for this amount, except for the Palm. The hotel itself has a pleasant lobby, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We were quickly into a suite which was very elegant and well worth the money. We had just come off an 18 day cruise, so having a bath and a shower was a wonderful sight, and the walk-in shower was excellent. The room is large, well furnished and had a safe which is always an advantage. Plenty of hanging space and drawers meant there is no problems with storing your clothes. I am a light sleeper but there was little noise to wake me up. We bed and breakfast and were stunned by the breakfast as it was three courses, including a variety of cooked dishes. We were most impressed, and the evening menu was not that expensive - around £11 for fish and chips. All in all, we could not fault this hotel, and it even had a gymn and swimming pool on the roof terrace. True there are better hotels in Dubai, but much more expensive and we felt that this was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Suites of size 30Sqm ;)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Dont be overwhelmed by the name of the hotel, it actually does not offer suites at the price of a room... two varieties of room as I was communicated 30sqm and 45sqm and the 30sqm room is actually smaller in size then a standard room elsewhere. Location is not bad considering its just next to MOE and in between two Metro Stations but the walk to either of the stations will not be less then 15 mins (1 km approx). Staff is ok, they try to treat you differently if they see you are a well informed traveler so play your cards as soon as you enter the hotel. There is a decent gym and a pool on the roof and is sufficient for people on the move. Overall it is a good value for money if you are looking to just dump your baggage and a shelter at night :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Peter2159
Reviews.Content: Good location, ideal for all the malls services and the metro system

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Rodge68 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel near the Mall of the Emirates and only a few minutes drive from water parks and the beach. The grand suite is perfect for families with young children although those with older children or travelling with friends might prefer to opt for two smaller 'suites' as sleeping areas are only partitioned with a curtain. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff are very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for excelent conditions, great service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: BogdanTTudor
Reviews.Content: For a very resonable price, I booked a 45sq suite with a nice view, just a little obstructed view on Burj Al Arab. Waking up in the morning with this iconic place of Dubai is a great way to start the morning. Not all the rooms are having this view, if you wanna have it you should ask for rooms on the rigth wing or center right facing the Highway. The location is very good, close to the metro station about 5m walk part of that you may travel inside the mall. You can find a lot of restaurants in the area, not fancy but clean and with tasty food. Rooms are perfect clean and service was flawless, providing also free wifi in the lobby. Definitely choose again in Dubai and also highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel in Dubai, well located”
Reviews.Author: whereintheworldisgpc
Reviews.Content: Very decent and modern hotel well located just some steps away from the mall of the emriates. Clean and spacious rooms with tastefull interior. Our room even had a view on the Burj Al Arab. Free wifi in lobby. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good service”
Reviews.Author: phik
Reviews.Content: Location - Perfect. 5 minutes walk away from Mall of Emirates. The only problem was crossing the busy road. Rooms - Booked a room for 3 at a bargain rate from the internet. One double bed, one sofa bed, 2 bathrooms, 1 toilet with a mini living room. Very comfortable and clean. Service - Excellent. Attended to by staff promptly. Internet connection - Paid connection in room but free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GT007 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to the Mall of the Emirates and a short distance to the Burj al Arab, the Marina, Jumeirah and Burj Kalifa. It is not a beach hotel but it offers the benefit of a good size roof top swimming pool whose surrounding deck might feel a bit undersized/overcrowded in the morning. The staff is really dedicated to making your stay enjoyable. The suites are really spacious and fitted with 2 shower rooms and and one bath. Ground floor restaurant and bar/terrace. Very convenient underground parking facilities. Local shops around + the Mall of the Emirates within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with Perfect Location Near Emirates Mall & metro Station (Walking) near to you super markets, dry clean , travel Agency, Pharmcy, Cafeteria. if the taxi driver ask you for the hotel place just tell him behind ibis hotel & near to emirates mall - Good Value. My second Visit 2 this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice size rooms”
Reviews.Author: mzz36f
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, 5 min walk to the Large Mall. The staff were good. Our flight was at midnight and we needed the room for a few extra hours and think we were over charged for this service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Accessibility”
Reviews.Author: MohabElSawaf Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent in location: 2 min walk to Mall of the Emirates & 2 min walk to metro station. In the same street a lot of grocery, super markets, dry clean, Lebanese pastry & cafe's.... The swimming pool (top roof pool) & the fitness center not at the level but accepted. However the area around the pool is very small that you feel not that comfort to stay longer time to let your kids play & enjoy. It was not crowded, so the lobby PC are free to log in to net freely or use your laptop with free Wifi only in reception. The rooms were not big as a suite but good as a regular dbl room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine - but sooo hard to find!”
Reviews.Author: BritOnHisHols
Reviews.Content: My title sums up our experience, the hotel was of a very good quality and I would rate it above the 3.5 stars we were told, we didn't try the food, but it looked OK. The only issue we had was getting there, as we got the Metro, rather than a cab which seems to be the default, so I'd like to give directions from the Mall of the Emirates Station. Enter the Mall and go the right hand side of the mall to Ski Dubai (ground floor) and when you get to the atrium in front of it follow it round to the right, past a food hall and through the revolving door. This brings you out in the taxi/car rank for the Kempinski hotel head for the road and turn left (very narrow pavement) head on to the junction (50m at most) and cross over. The hotel is then visible diagonally to your right (at November 2011) and is opposite the Golden Tulip that is directly opposite you, there is a patch of waste ground to cross to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: nomadBangalore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to the Mall of the Emirates and is ideal for families on vacation because of the location. Located between Downtown Dubai and the Dubai Marina with the Souk Madinat and other nice locations close by compared to a down town hotel. Business travellers could use the Metro to get to most locations in Dubai as the Metro station is located in the Mall of the Emirates (10-15 mins walk though!). The rooms are nice and clean and have an additional sofa bed in case kids or three people are staying. The bathroom is really tiny and shower area is also small for regular people and would probably be really difficult for people on the heavier side. The bath tub could be used in that case though! Lack of local food availability around the area though in case people like to try the local cuisine or something different from what is available at the hotel. Finding the hotel on your own is also difficult and I recommend taking a taxi to this hotel the first time to get familiar with your surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location, hard to find”
Reviews.Author: Honeysooze
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and perfectly suitable as a hotel, but very, very hard to find. We got the metro to the Mall of the Emirates, then struggled for about an hour and a half trying to find the place. People in the mall itself (on the information desks) weren't particularly helpful, with one of them never having heard of it. If you're looking for a place to stay that's easy to get to, without constantly using taxis, and central, then don't stay here. However, the Mall of the Emirates is one of the stops for the Big Red Bus hop-on-hop-off tours. (to get to the hotel from the mall, go through to the ski centre on the ground floor, go right, past the food court and the Kempinsky Hotel in the mall and out the double doors. Once outside, follow the road round to the left, cross the road and the empty lot and it's there)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Mall of Emirates. Very friendly staff all over. Good swiming pool on top of the hotel. Free internet access. Price fairly, so recommentain for sure. next time will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “feedback”
Reviews.Author: ManinderSethi
Reviews.Content: it was a great experience, rooms were nice, staff is really good, though didnt enjoy the breakfast much but room service was good. Location is just next to Mall of Emirates - a premium shopping destination but still far from other places. nite life is almost dead in the area & other happening places are bit far off.

Reviews.Title: “Near Mall of Emirates!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 5 minute walking distance from Mall of Emirates. Helpful staff and pretty decent breakfast. If you book early enough you could get one of the 'suite' rooms which are pretty spacious, very clean and comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Proximity”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just behind the mall of emirates and really convenient when you also want to use the metro service which takes you to virtually to all part of dubai. Rooms is very clean and room service is excellent. A small suggestion to the hotel is to consider adding the breakfast or half board meals as an option in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulose Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: fabulouse hotel with lovely spaciose rooms. pool area is nice and relaxing on the rooftop and the breakfast is good too. the location only a 2 min walk to the mall of the emirates. shopping heaven or all the shopoholics. train stop is also only a 300m walk. would recoment this hotel to all my family and friends looking to stay in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms in OK location”
Reviews.Author: ekholden Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for Mall access and Jumeriah attractions...metro very close. We parked and it was very convenient even if driving in Dubai is more scary than Wild Wadi! The restaurant food and hotel drink is expensive, but the Mall had lots to choose from. There are a few take aways across the road and the pizza place is particulalry good. Our son even had a haircut on the street which was cheap and an experience rolled in. Good place to take a family...

Reviews.Title: “Dubai stopover”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, very modern, free internet usage and housekeeping responded quite quickly to any additional room requests like extra bottled water, coffeee, tea etc.. The room we booked could sleep up to 4 people as it had a sofa bed which hotel staff had made ready for our stay. The hotel is very close to The Mall of the Emirates so if you don't care for hotel food, plenty of options closeby. This was our second stay there this year, definitely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Short business trip”
Reviews.Author: Looknfeel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: perfect precise, no nonsense, all comfort stay. Exactly what a business traveler needs, good sleep, nice shower, nice sumptuous breakfast to kick start the day and you are off. Enough choice for a casual meet or a drink in the evening summarizing the day events and checking mails. Cheerful ready to help staff. good location next to the mall of the emirates (though little off from the business bay and WTC area) but not such a big deal as the taxi and metro options are at doorstep. GOOD Value for money as a business traveler is more out than in and when in needs all the comfort one can get.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is convenient to Mall of Emirates, rooms quite good for price, recommend for short stays only, clean and well serviced. Hotel staff friendly, Needs wireless in room, also breakfast should be included in rate. Overall rank 7/10

Reviews.Title: “It was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. All the staff members are very warm and friendly. Especially Kenneth and another Kenyan gentleman. Is not because they are Africans that's why am praising them but i believe they happen to be around most of the time. Our regards to everyone and continue the good work. Regards Mr & Mrs Ampofo

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gferraez
Reviews.Content: This a business hotel it has a great locations very closed to emirats mall, price wise is good it's clean Here is the sradegy you should follow, if you are on a budget stay in this hotel while you are touring around and taking excursions and after that go to a really fancy hotel to enjoyed it and rest We stayed 3 nigths here before moving to the Armani hotel which you can find my review too, it was a good choise now if you have a lot of money defiantly stayed In a nice hotel of the time Overall good for what you pay for, two very important points for some people it only has wifi for free in the lobby, and it does not have international plugs for your electronics so be sure to take your power adapter

Reviews.Title: “Stay @ Novotel Suites MoE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here which is located nearest to Mall of the Emirates. With two kids we got a well appointed room with two double beds and sofa (the downside was just one toilet though the bathroom is seperate). Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Shake84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel due to it's proximity to the Mall of the Emirates and enjoyed my stay there. The room was larger than i expected it to be and had 2 bathrooms, a large bed and a seating area that had a pull out couch. The mall was close to the hotel, but getting there by foot is a hassle and quite dangerous because you have to cross some main roads. I had no issues with the service and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “your hotel is Suite Novotel Mall Of The Emirates”
Reviews.Author: king0fpain
Reviews.Content: good rates , good and friendly staff , good location and good for familes

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish service”
Reviews.Author: Faisalalmatar
Reviews.Content: Rubbish staff unfortenatly and not respectfull at all, especially the duty manager (faith). She is speeking loudly and i advice her to work with dogs and animals better than working with a great name like novotel. I advice every body to not go for this hotel because of the team there.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service and exaggerated prices for drinks”
Reviews.Author: HermJP Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The receptionist did not understand how to find the reservation. Then - even though we arrived at 2:00am in the morning - the reserved rooms were not ready that we had top pay for the previous day. The breakfast room is shared with the cheaper Ibis hotel next door. But you pay more at the Novotel. There is no price list for the ini bar. Since it was my friend's birthday we thought we use a glass of champagne. Attention!!!!! Never do this. A 0.25ml mini bottle of Mumm was charged for 380 Dirham, which is the equivalent of 75 Euros!!!!!!! This is outrageous and criminal. We will never ever stay at this hotel in Dubai again even though we go there with two people every month. Stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “It's your address in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: fadi_almashat Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Its just perfect! Stunning design, spacious rooms, excellend location, quick high quality service.... and more I only have small comment on the bathroom because it is a little bit small, other than that the hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Budget but ok !”
Reviews.Author: peter216
Reviews.Content: Very poor breakfast plus had to pay 30 dhs to use the pool next door

Reviews.Title: “welll located, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrFunnyPerth
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel last week on a business trip to Dubai. It is close to the Mall of the Emirates. The rooms are very comfotable and you can split the living area from the sleeping area with a movable particion.There is a good sized pool on roof and gym and restaurants on the ground floor. there are also small grocery shops, chemists and other cafes close. Underground Parking available

Reviews.Title: “Novotel was value for money”
Reviews.Author: AartiSaran
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel-Mall of Emirates for 3 nights and it was a very pleasant stay. The icing on the cake was that we got it employee rate. The location is ideal and the service was okay. As it is close to the Mall, you will never be bored. There are food stalls just outside hotel, if you want to skip the hotel food. The room decor is pleasant and we had a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another horrible one!!!”
Reviews.Author: belal30
Reviews.Content: First of all, guys, please read the fine print at their web site, do not be fooled by thinking it is in or part of the mall of emirates, it is just a name!!! Mall of the emirates has only two hotels and this is not one of them!!! I stayed there for two nights, service is very slow, i needed to wait 45 minutes to receive the baby crip and 30 minutes to get help with my bags upon check out!!! If you have a car, do not expect v. Parking, you have to help yourself in that area! I ordered room service dinner from their only restaurant, it came in plastic containers with plastic every thing!!!! Not flexible at all regarding checkout time, they refused to extend even half an hour more than 12 pm!!!! Don't think it would be a good choice if you are looking for comfortable and stress free stay

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Service, Great Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Suze230
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one night at the hotel as a stopover on our way to Paris from Brisbane, Australia. Our travel agent has told me that the hotel is right inside the Mall of the Emirates, but it is actually a city block away and not that straight forward to walk to as there are busy roads in between and we had to look for the entrance. If you want a hotel actually in the mall, we passed the entrance to Kempinkski Hotel inside the mall and it received great reviews. However, that aside, our hotel was very nice, the staff were extremely helpful. Benson, who both worked on reception and brought our bags to the room was charming - I asked him about tipping (always a sticky problem for Aussies as he don't tip as a rule) and he explained that in Dubai, "tipping is from the heart" and was quite happy that I only had a very small tip to give as it was accompanied by a smile and thank you. (Benson told me when asked that the word for thank you in Arabic is 'shakran'). We didn't have much time and left it a bit late to organise anything for the morning we had free before our flight. Benson suggests talking to them as soon as you check in if you only have one night and they will organise their driver to take you on a tour - slightly more expensive than a planned tour, but he recommended this if you have limited time as you can please yourself how long you spend at each place. Another tip is book ahead if you want to have morning tea at the Burj al Arab as it is booked a fairly long way in advance. My daughter didn't really want to go sightseeing so instead we spent the morning by the roof top pool, which was delightful and not to busy. The lifesaver on duty was very polite and helpful. All together, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can Hardly be Defined As Suite”
Reviews.Author: siskebap
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a business trip , the hotel is fine but they have done room modifications for it to be defined as a suite. Such as the bathroom and toilet are seperate, with 2 meters between their rooms. At the end , it could have been a good hotel room but they pushed hard so that they can rename it as Suite Novotel. There was no need, just name it as Novotel, we would still stay there. The main light was not working and the room service Ramadan Sahur menu is served with plastic plates and forks etc. which was under the standarts.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Uli62166
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for spacious rooms - this will be a great choice to stay in. I like particularly the partition into sleeping and sitting area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The A-la carte Breakfast was ok if you have to get up early but for late risers I would definitively suggest to explore one of the many options of the Mall of the Emirates which is just one street crossing away. We had a pleasant stay and I can really recommend this hotel - simple, cean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service from reception”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed last year at the hotel with my sister, was extremely happy. Booked my stay in August, very unhappy experience as follows:- 1. Tried to contact the reception, housekeeping, deli etc for about 20min no reply, the evening of my last day. Was about to go to reception, tried once more & eventually got through. The very same happened the day before. In actual fact, there if hardly any quests at reception, extremely quiet. 2. The morning of my last stay, was just about to leave for an appointment, got a call from reception requesting me to pack up in order to change rooms from the 1st floor to the 6th floor. I mentioned to him that I will do so on my return later the evening. He insisted that I need to move immediately, he came & moved me, I repeatedly told him I'm late for my appointment, ignored me. I don't see the reason why they not informed me the evening before or early morning. Unsure whether I would recommend the hotel to any family or friends. Regards. Shamim

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: tokyorose2008
Reviews.Content: The places I have stayed for more than double the cost in Dubai have not been as good. Such a convenient place, clean, comfortable rooms, good restaurant and gym. The security is good and right next to the amazing Mall of the emirates featuring a ski park, 5 star dining and excellent shops and kids play area as well as a supermarket, fast food outlets and the lovely Kempinski Hotel. I liked the computers in the lobby, nice lobby - hard to complain. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I Think that the Hotel is very good for the value of money and it is too close to The Mall of Emrates which includes a Metro station, the hotel could be considered as clean hotel but it includes less entertainment facilities, also the restraunts menu is so limited...........it was a good stay but the Hotel is boring.......

Reviews.Title: “Good room and good service”
Reviews.Author: Surajjagtiani Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the rooms were very neat and clean Th staf was very polite and friendly also since the hotel is relatively new the rooms r Very well maintained I would definetly recommend it to a friend .... The hotel is very close to. Mall of emirates so that was great n also they have pick up and drop services to The city center and JBR we made use of that a couple of times

Reviews.Title: “loving it!!”
Reviews.Author: babyrock246
Reviews.Content: I like luxury as much as the next man and am not finicky ,am in the hotel right now and am loving it so far,all the reception staff were very welcoming,oh u need to know anything ask for keneth ...i loved my suite just like the pictures will post pics soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Large room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: SurabayaExpat Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Novotel is right besides an Ibis and they share certain facilities, e.g. the restaurant and small roof-top pool. The location is about 20 minutes from town, but right besides a large mall. All the taxi drivers seemed to be familiar with it. Pro's: The rooms are large and have a dining area. Therefor quite a few times we bought food from the restaurants across the street (the pizza and food from Turkey are good) or from the mall nearby. There is a Carrefour in the mall and a small convenience store across the street where we bought our breakfast necessities. All-in-all convenient if you can't (small kids) or don't want to eat out all the time. Note there is no kitchenette though. Con's: The walk to the mall is not clearly indicated and involves crossing a busy street, going under a bridge and entering though the entrance of a different hotel. The hotel pool is very small and boring. All-in-all good value for money for such a large room.

Reviews.Title: “My best ever in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Jolize
Reviews.Content: Ive been travelling to Dubai for the past 12 years about 3 times a year and have had many accomodation expriences, most of it bad ones but my stay with my family in April at the Novotel Mall of Emirates was really worth writing about. Not only was it within VERY easy walking distance from the Mall of Emirates (still one of the best in Dubai), it was also within walking distance of the new Dubai Metro. The rates were extremely affordable and the rooms were stunning. Our 6 yr old son shared our family room with us and there was plenty of space for all us, including an extra bathroom. Many of the hotels I stayed in Dubai previously I found the breakfast to not be suitable for my Western taste and very limited. The breakfast menu at the Novotel was not only totally catering for the Western palate, it was also interesting, modern and really nice. The business centre is very well equiped and free of charge. I could catch up easily with my business emails. The staff was wonderfully helpful when my husband and son wanted to do a trip to Ferrari World in Abu Dabi. They helped with bookings as well as transport arrangements. When we needed assistance with the VERY complicated visa application system, they were most helpful with information. This will most defenitely be my hotel of choice for any upcoming trip to Dubai for both business and family.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Suites - Al Barsha = Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: dazk55 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location - all the staff are very, very helpful. Be sure to state if you prefer a non-smoking room when booking (I do not understand why there are still hotels / hotel rooms that permit smoking...???!!! ). Pool nice, bar, nice, restaurants nice. And only 5 mins walk from the Mall of the Emirates and pretty central for all your Dubai holiday needs. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Complain”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were satisfy with everythings but, the problem is that the hotel blocked 4000 Derhams from my card at the time of reserving the room online while we were unaware of that and when we checked out they gave the whole the money again with my son's credit card. I have two questions : first, why they didn't take the money from the amount which they had blocked, which faced me to some problem relating to amount in my card there, and secondly, why they haven't release the money yet.

Reviews.Title: “A well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Suite is a very good, clean and well located hotel with an excellent quality/price ratio, especially as it is the only hotel which can accommodate easily a family with three children in their Master Suite Rooms without getting through the hurdle of being obliged to book two or three rooms which may not be connecting in any other hotel. Another advantage is the location adjoining to the monorail station and the Mall of the Emirates. The only disadvantage is the quality of the food which could be enhanced as well as the lack of service for the bathrooms: soaps and shampoo were not given every morning and we had to ask three times for additional towels, which we did never get...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: DarshanM Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Got a decent deal online and the location also is quite good. However the service was horrible. I called house keeping numerous times but no response. Then called reception and requested stuff again no response. everything you need from tooth brush to soap needs to be asked a few times before they respond. I hate hotels where nobody answers the call.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Dubai Mall Trip”
Reviews.Author: harkleynz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were more than happy with this hotel. It is sometimes difficult to find reasonably priced accommodation for a family travelling with 2 teenagers. We also have friends who stayed here with 3 youngsters. The hotel is excellently located being walking distance from the Mall of the Emirates (although it can be a tricky 'walk' with regards to crossing a few roads). Some people might not appreciate that the three sleeping zones are separated by a curtain but that was fine for our family. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience round the corner from MoE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The suites are located just round the corner from Mall of the Emirates (MoE). If you are looking for a mid-budget hotel in where the action is then this is the place for you to stay. I was travelling with my extended family and the stay was very comfortable. The staff was quick to respond to service requests. The hotel location was very convenient if you wanted to visit MoE or access the Dubai metro from there. Overall had a good stay and enjoyed the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not good value...”
Reviews.Author: angmac48
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location and the hotel itself is modern and clean. The price was very cheap and unfortunately you get what you pay for. We booked breakfast on the website thinking it would be a nice hotel buffet-it's not. Do not book breakfast online, it's actually more expensive than if you pay on the day (the price on the net is incorrect) and the only option on the net is expensive and it turns out there are much cheaper options in person as well. When I asked about why it is more expensive to purchase breakfast online, one manager wasn't aware and said he would bring it up at the next meeting. Another staff member just agreed that it was and couldn't tell me why-neither cared or did anything about it. Twin share rooms are a double bed and a couch (not a sofa bed you sleep on a couch). Hotel pushes expensive cabs, take the normal ones. One day we returned from a long day out and the lifts weren't working due to fire testing. We were told to wait 5 mins, we did, and then we were told to take the stairs ( to the 4th floor bags and all). Pool is tiny with very few sun beds. Toiletries in room are minimal- no body lotion, shampoo and conditioner combined and hand soap is not replaced between stays and is rather a large pump bottle that is replenished for the next guests. Overall, everything I've mentioned has been mentioned before on this site-unfortunately it was a last minute booking and didn't have time to check. Staff rude, but I guess if you pay peanuts you get monkeys. Stay somewhere slightly more expensive and get better service. Would not recommend this hotel unless you know what you're in for and are looking for somewhere cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel - well located”
Reviews.Author: VivekH Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A three minute walk from the Mall of the Emirates (still blazingly hot in summer though), so very well-located. A room with two bathrooms and sleeping five comfortably (two doubles and a single) for a princely sum of (avg) 500 Dhs a night - so, 100 Dhs/head - which is a steal. Free wi-fi and gaming consoles in the lobby. Helpful, cheerful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located, good value for money . Gopa, Bangalore, India”
Reviews.Author: Goparoamer
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Novotel, Mall of the Emirates recently. It not within the MOE premises as the Kempinski is , but across the road from the MOE. I had read a lot of bad reviews about this place , but decided to go ahead with the booking , since it was located close to the new Dubai Downtown district and also within my budget . We figured that we would not be spending too much time there as we would be out sight seeing and shopping . Was pleasantly surprised by the good service and the room ( triple sharing- for us and our twelve year old) . The room though a little small had a separate bath and lav. Breakfast that was part of the package was basic , but sufficient. This hotel and the IBIS next door are connected and can be classified as a business hotel offering free wi fi . We two night stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Paul-Wenda Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is a little way out of the main tourist areas of Dubai but right next to the Mall of The Emirates so everything was a short taxi ride. The service was attentive and polite, rooms were fresh and modern, I found the bed too hard my wife loved it. Free wifi in lobby but had to pay for it in my room? Overall the place was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean large rooms”
Reviews.Author: BigFatTourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located approx 2 minutes walk from the Mall of the Emirates, which we found to be very useful as you have access to many restaurants and shops until midnight when the Mall closes. The Mall also has a metro station in it which is very useful ( compared to the Dubai Mall where you need to get a bus from the metro station to the Mall). The room was a spacious, modern, clean and bright suite, comprising a toilet room with a basin, and a separate bathroom with bath and standup shower, a bedroom and a curtain dividing the bedroom from the lounge area. One wall is covered with fitted wardrobes giving plenty of storage space, and there is a fridge. The hotel has a swimming pool on the roof and a gym, however we found it too hot ( in April) to use the pool in the daytime. There are computers in the lobby with Internet free of charge, however wifi is only provided if you pay more. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for its modern clean rooms and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jackoIreland
Reviews.Content: Great value for 300dhs per night for a decent sized room. Mall of the Emirates is 5 mins walk away where you can catch the Metro to other parts of Dubai. Taxis available outside the hotel whenever we stepped outside. Hotel lobby is nicely furnished. I used the restaurant for breakfast only which was basic. the service and cleanliness was excellent. The rooms are also very clean and comfortable. The A/C was easy to use. We will return in November.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: davidli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 5 nights as we wanted to be in the area and it was very inexpensive compared to the Pullman Mall of Emirates . It was a wise decision as no matter where you stay in Dubai you will inevitably have to take a taxi or transit to get to your destination. It's a 6 -8 minute walk to the Mall of Emirates ( walk diagonally across the empty lot towards the mall entrance located at the Kempinski hotel) . There are 2 minimarts and a few cafes and restaurants located across the street , we found the Turkiye restaurant to be very good. We found the bed to be very firm so my wife actually slept on the little day bed/ sofa and I slept on the bed . The free internet computers where very handy . I thought the restaurant was very expensive considering the class of hotel and always went across the street for breakfast /lunch. Overall it was the right choice for us as we spent very little time at the hotel and really only used it as a place to sleep. I would recommend it for budget travelers who are looking for a clean modern hotel in the Mall of Emirates area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel fantastic staff fantasctic location”
Reviews.Author: strudledoodle
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was amazing, room was great double bed and single bed. bathroom,shower and seperate toilet. our room overlooked the burj al arab and jumierah beach. The roof top pool was great it was never overcrowded and the perfect size to either swim or just cool down. The life guards were very friendly and always had our beds ready with towels. The hotel has a 24 hour cafe which was great as our flight arrived at midnight and the day we left we had to get picked up at 4am so it was nice to have a drink. Water is provided free every day and there is also a water cooler in the gym that is free to use. The Mall of the emirates is a 2 minute walk away where there is too many restaurants to chose from. The staff in the hotel were all very nice and would not walk past without saying hello. Although the hotel is located near a busy road you could not hear any traffic at all even when you are up on the pool. Overall this was a perfect hotel and I can not wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ibrahim25
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Staff very helpful and friendly. The grand suite was very spacious. Rooms were made up promptly in the mornings and all our requests were provided, extra towels, water bottles. Excellent facilities with internet access and playstations. Not a massive pool but enough for adults and children to enjoy. Excellent location for the mall and metro. The hotel is new and modern. Rooms are very clean with lots of room. The shuttle to the beach was great- on time and efficient. Fantastic value for money

Reviews.Title: “We would go back anytime!!”
Reviews.Author: SOUHOB
Reviews.Content: very good location some steps to Emirate Mall and Metro station .staff were so helpful and the room was always cleaned-this is a great hotel to a very nice price at a great location. We would go back anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: CQ2007
Reviews.Content: After a series of bad reviews on Trip Advisor, I hesitated in staying at this hotel. But having made an advance booking and payment, I decided to stick it through. First, the positives. The room is huge. We stayed in a Master Suite Room with a queen sized bed and a sofa bed. It easily fit three adults. It also had two bathrooms and a separate toilet- which is very welcome when sharing a room with two women. The room had all the essential amenities: mini bar, a safe, and water heater. The room also had a separate thermostat. We found the service also spotless. We asked for a converter, an extra blanket, and new towels, and these were brought it in very quickly. The staff were welcoming and nice. Oh by the way, they let us check in at 11 am. The negatives. Essentially only one. The location. The hotel is not exactly easy to find so best to get accurate directions before you go here. It says Suitehotel Mall of the Emirates but it is really about a couple of blocks away from the exit. We had to cross a couple of streets to get to the hotel (which can be difficult if you had luggage/children in tow). Overall, the location is convenient. It is near the Mall of the Emirates and metro stations. This is a very good value hotel in expensive Dubai. I recommend it to most travellers (except to those with children).

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lolobkk
Reviews.Content: Booked a few days at this Suite Novotel following review from tripadvisor , room are big , nice and functional , toilet are separated and very tiny , that is the only negative point I will say. Excellent location and walking distance to Mall of the emirates. Excellent service at reception , staff are nice.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: cd6_69
Reviews.Content: I booked a opportunist package but came to the hotell and they said it was not valid in Dubai. They did not offer me anything else. The service at the hotel sucks. Also I got a smoking room with 2 small children, although I hade already gotten a confirmation the day before that they would hold a non smoking room for me. The breakfast price if booked from Accor.com is AED 66 and at the hotel the most expensive breakfast cost AED 65. There are more options if you buy the breakfast at the hotel. What a scam when you book from Accor.com! The service at the breakfast is really poor except of the waitress that comes every 1-2 minutes asking if you want more coffee or tea. Is she on commission? Everyday we have to ask for 4 plates, 4 cups, and so on. Dont they see that we are 4 persons that want to eat? The staff recommend the private taxis outside the hotel that are the dubble price. It cost AED 49 to go to the beach with those and a regular taxi cost AED 27,50 back to the hotel. The lamps did not work in the room one day and I called roomservice. It took 45 minutes before they came. Service is really bad! Also, the pool is really small. Its smaller than a private pool that people have in the back yard. This hotel is located next to IBIS hotel which is almost simular to this but cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good but bewrae”
Reviews.Author: tari11
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful. I forgot my wallet in my room one afternoon and returned to find 100 USD missing from my purse. When i reported this insident, they duty manager would acknowledge that it had happened, insisted that i had made a mistake. She kept telling me if it was in the safe it would ahve been their problem but cause it wasn't it wasn't their problem. She promised to follow it up but never came back to me after that. So be warned there is a thief in the hotel. I enjoyed my stay there but the incident ruined the rest of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rude,Overcharge, Dirty and Not Worth The Money. Dismal & Overpriced Breakfast. Sad sad place.”
Reviews.Author: TripReviewer2012
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3pm exhausted from our flight. The rude Russian girl at the counter told us we had to wait for the room to be cleaned. She insisted it would take 3 hours. The prices when we booked were increased by 30% when we showed up. The room "suite" is smaller than most non-suite rooms in Dubai. The bathroom is like an airplane bathroom. No hot water. No clean towels. THe hotel has some racket going also with the taxis outside. Sad, sad place. DO NOT STAY HERE. It's a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Wellina
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. First of all, the location is great. It is right next to Mall of the Emirates and it is not too far from The Palm or Jumeirah beach. Down Town and Burj Khalifa was some 15 -20 minutes away by taxi - but don't forget that traffic in Dubai can be a bit crazy. In the area, within walking distance from Novotel, there are cafés, Pizza, miniamarts, spas and pharmacies. Metro is close and there where always taxis to get. We stayed in a Master Suite which was brilliantly furnished. With two curtains we got two bedrooms and a living area. Or simply just one very big room. The kids shared the sofa bed and there is one more divan by the TV. The double bed was a bit hard and uncomfortable for my taste and the AC system was a bit loud. But after an activity filled day I was so tired so I fell a sleep anyhow. The only part I really did not like was breakfast. First morning me and one of the sons went for the buffet, which is located in Ibis Hotels facilities right next door, accessible from the inside. Food was ok and kids under 12 (I think) ate for free. The second morning I decided to try one of Novotel's set menus. After three waiters and 40 minutes I still had not gotten my food. That is when I left, angry and hungry. It also irritated me that nobody helped us at 1 AM when we arrived with luggage and sleeping kids from the airport. There was one from the staff out side, but he cared more to continue chatting with a friend. Since no bellboys work during the night, a man from housekeeping helped us after check in with the bags. He on the other hand was very tentative and asked if we needed an extra pillow for one of the boys. So, the overall impression is that despite some difficulties with arranging late check in and bad service from a few, this is a great hotel to a very nice price at a great location. We would go back anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor room service”
Reviews.Author: indianfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and walking distance from Mall of the Emirates, but the service given that it's a Novotel is very poor We were with very young kids and hence would be eating in the room almost all meals before heading out for our Dubai jaunts. But after every trip, in spite of reminders, the houskeeping would leave the room uncleared

Reviews.Title: “The most Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: kimayaMumbai
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Suite Novotel was for 6 days..in Feb 2011 From the time we booked the hotel, we go an amazing welcome. there was a time whn i needed a pharmacy store at 12 at night wherein the hotel helped me in 10 mins.. didnt have to walk out of my room. Great hospitality, no hasssles while check out and check inn.. The location of the hotel was just perfect, close to the Mall of emirates.. walking distance of abt 5 mins.. where one could judt go and indulge.. All in all, it was a v happy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: CMSlater
Reviews.Content: Very luxurious hotel at very reasonable price. Large room with lounge area, great pool on the roof and complimentary internet in the foyer. Staff very helpful. Only issue is that it isn't actually located within the 'Mall of the Emirates' which meant a long walk through the busy shops with our suitcases to get there - very minor issue and definitely wouldn't put me off staying there again! While in Dubai would recommend the Desert Safari through Arabian Adventures and remember that Friday is a religious day for Muslim people so lots of things are closed in the afternoon including some public transport.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT A 4 STAR HOTEL AND IS SHARED WITH IBS - 2 HOTEL IN ONE.”
Reviews.Author: nur1
Reviews.Content: Its official this not a 4 star hotel, at the entrance a big sign says its a 3 star hotel - please do not market something which is not true - also customers please note its communal areas are shared with IBS brand - my next room guest were IBS customers paying £40.00 per room while I paid £75.00 per night Rooms are clean, but 3 washroom per room!! Not so clean and unless you are less then 6ft you will have difficult using the showers they are small - you cannot turn. Also I had an early flight arrival even though they had rooms available the reception would not allow me to check in early and they have charged me for 3 nights rather then 2. Please do not get stung. Overall OK hotel, good location - but very very basic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Gr8, Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: adishm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading some gr8 reviews as well as "WebSite" mentioning the Internet is free ( It's free only in Lobby ). Also the word "Suite" used in the name made it more attractive proposition. The reality was much different, The room size is same and the Sofa and dining table make it look smaller and clumsy... The matress was hard, and when i complained they had no solution... Blunt answer was... It's the same in all rooms... They ran out of Adaptors when i requested for one... The staff was not friendly and courtious at all... Mostly i felt like an unwanted guest in the house... In the Gym, they have 4 equipments, 2 treadmills and 2 cycles and one stepper... One treadmill and the stepper was not working... for my entire stay of 5 days.... The room was clean and tidy... but thts all the poisitive point i could gather...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for any trip to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: laughingboy01
Reviews.Content: I found this place thanks to TripAdvisor last year, and spent a couple of days here after splurging out on The Atlantis. The kids actually preferred the Novotel as the room was so spacious and whilst it doesn't have any outside space to talk of it's very well located - a short walk to the Mall of the Emirates and a short taxi journey to Wild Wadi, Jumeirah Beach Park etc. The staff are super friendly and helpful, and it's great value. This year we spent a whole week here and it was perfect - especially as I discovered you can pay 100-150 Dirhams to get into most of the great hotel beach clubs, so we went to different places every day, for far less than staying at those hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The most spacious room you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: Orencio
Reviews.Content: This hotel has really spacious rooms. We booked the Grand Suite for two adults and 2 children which had three rooms and three bathrooms. The staff at reception, housekeeping and the restaurants were really, really friendly and efficient. What's more this hotel has a fantastic location.
